article.description: Predrag Stojakovic scored 24 points, including four free throws the final minute, as the Sacramento Kings held off the undermanned Houston Rockets 89-84 Tuesday night.

related.description: Rockets star Steve Francis will be out four to six weeks because of an injury to his left foot, coach Rudy Tomjanovich said Tuesday.
related.linkText: Rockets' Francis out 4-6 weeks with foot injury
related.title: Francis sidelined 4-6 weeks
related.headline: Francis sidelined 4-6 weeks

article.headline: Kings hold off surprising Rockets

images.name: Christie_Doug 112701 inline
images.caption: Doug Christie had 14 points and three steals.

article.linkText: Minus Francis, Rockets barely fall to Kings
article.story:
HOUSTON (AP) -- Even with their two leading scorers out with injuries, the Houston Rockets made a game of it. Predrag Stojakovic scored 24 points, including four free throws the final minute, as the Sacramento Kings held off the undermanned Rockets 89-84 Tuesday night. The Rockets were without their starting backcourt of Steve Francis, sidelined 4-6 weeks with a foot injury, and Cuttino Mobley, who is day-to-day with sprained ankle. But Houston received a career high 20 points from Oscar Torres, 19 from Moochie Norris and 18 from Kenny Thomas to battle down to the final seconds. "It doesn't matter who you suit up if you do the right things," coach Rudy Tomjanovich said. "It doesn't matter what your name is or what your credentials are, if you do the right things you have a chance to win. By the same token, if you have all your All-Star players and don't do the right things, you'll lose." Thomas added a season-high 19 rebounds and Kelvin Cato had a season-high 13 rebounds as the Rockets came from 15 points down in the third quarter to briefly lead in the fourth. "I think we were just sharing the ball and that's where we got our momentum," Thomas said. "Of course, we could have used (Francis and Mobley) because those are our one-two guys. Without them, most people would have thought the odds were we wouldn't have a chance to win without them. But we played hard and had a chance at the end." The Kings beat the Rockets for the sixth straight time. "We have to play the same against anybody out there," said Stojakovic, who hit two free throws with 36 seconds to play for an 85-80 lead, then hit two more with seven seconds to wrap the game up. "We've played these guys before and we know that they're capable. Last night we lost to a team (Memphis) that didn't have three starters, so we can't worry about who's on the floor for the other team." Coach Rick Adelman was just glad the Kings improved to 4-4 on the road after losing at Memphis 98-94 Monday. "Give Houston a lot of credit," Adelman said. "Norris was very aggressive and I thought Thomas was terrific all night. You've got to turn it up on the road in order to win. We've got to get better at that. "I'm not surprised at Houston. Norris, (Glen) Rice and (Kevin) Willis are all quality players. And with (Francis and Mobley) out, we knew they would all get about 40 more touches. We lost last night to a team that didn't have three starters so we knew it was going to be tough tonight." Sacramento led by as many as 15 in the third, but Norris scored 12 points in a 21-6 run that knotted the score at 64-64 with 2:10 to play in the quarter. Mike Bibby added 18 points while Bobby Jackson had 14, including eight in the fourth quarter, as the Kings beat the Rockets for the sixth straight time. Doug Christie had 14, including two free throws with 19 seconds to play. A 7-0 run at the start of the second period helped the Kings open a 10-point lead as Stojakovic had 11 at that point. With the help of 14 from Bibby, they stretched it to as many as 12 before settling for a 52-41 halftime lead.

Game notes
It was only the second time Francis and Mobley have missed a game at the same time. The first was last Dec. 23 when the Rockets lost to Golden State 95-87 at Compaq Center ... The Kings beat Houston by 36 points just eight days (Nov. 19) earlier in Sacramento, the worst loss of the year for the Rockets ... Sacramento is 7-0 at home and 4-4 on the road ... The Kings have held their last nine opponents under 100 points.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
